All Reviews

  1. I was skeptical about this exfoliator when I saw the overwhelming amount of 5-star reviews, but after receiving my order yesterday and trying it out, I can attest to its effectiveness!<br /><br />Hitting my 30's, my skin has gone down hill. My face always felt rough, even though I have tried to exfoliate with other facial scrubs--it has a very unhealthy texture and I was breaking out way more than a 30 year old should. After just one use of Cure, I immediately felt a difference in texture and appearance. The &#34;white balls&#34; that form are definitely dead skin because the gel is not goopy (it's rather liquidy) and it does not congeal. It's pricier, but the instructions recommend 3-5 pumps, twice a week, which is really not that much considering how small the pump is so one bottle should last a while. Definitely adding this to my normal skincare routine!

  7. This is a pretty great exfoliator. It works by rolling up into little balls and using those balls to very gently physically exfoliate. When I bought this product, I had not really read up on it enough to know this, so I confusedly thought it was a chemical exfoliant. So I guess that's important to consider-- this is NOT a chemical exfoliant! I usually stick to only chemical exfoliants, as most physical ones are too abrasive for my sensitive skin. But if I had to pick one, this gentle one would be it!

  19. Cure Gel, how do I love thee, let me count the ways...<br /><br />So I was skeptical, but decided to give it a try after having a woman in a Vegas skincare shop try to sell me on a similar exfoliating gel that cost $200 (yes, you read that correctly!) Of course, I declined her kind offer and moved on with my life, and then I randomly discovered Cure on amazon and decided to give it a shot.<br /><br />I'm so glad I did! The first time I used it, I didn't even have a chance to let it sit on my skin first - it started balling upon immediate contact with my face! And I had thought I was rather nicely exfoliated to begin with - guess not. So I immediately repeated and came away with a lot less \\"crud\\" the second time around. I repeated again last night and had some exfoliation happening, but not nearly as much. And again this morning (yes, I know I need to slow down before my whole face peels off, but it's addictive!) and was thrilled to find that there was very little sloughing. So now I know I'm thoroughly exfoliated! At this point, I'll move to figuring out how often is right for me (likely every other day or so, to keep the acne at bay.)<br /><br />As for my skin, my face looks amazing! I have been struggling with a bad breakout and this stuff got all the bumps almost completely gone after just 3 uses. My face is super soft and glowing and I can see a dramatic improvement - blemishes are almost completely gone, pores are looking smaller, and the texture is greatly improved.<br /><br />I'll update this post after I've used Cure for a few weeks, but I'm really loving it so far!<br /><br />Oh, and PS - I've also been using it on my hands and it works great. I can see improvement already. I also repeated it several times and it's obvious that the balling is truly dead skin because after using it 3 times in a row last night, I had zero balling on the last try. Then this morning I had a little, but much less than yesterday. This stuff is for real.

It recommends using it twice a week but with the other masks and scrubs, I limit it to once a week. You don't need to use much so this bottle should last you a little while, but don't forget most cosmetics have a shelf life so don't be afraid to be generous.<br /><br />To use it, just add two pumps to your fingertips and apply all over the face. After a minute, rub it until you the tiny grit of the dead skin cells on your fingers. Get all of the skin around the face and rinse off cleanly.   24. This exfoliator really does live up to the hype. I count on it to rid my skin of dead cells before cleaning at least 2-3 times a week. However, I have relatively hardy skin, and I disagree with the claim that it can be used daily. It is far too wasteful to use it that way. It also is possible to over exfoliate with this product, though it doesn't hurt or sting like a physical or stronger chemical exfoliator will. I noticed my skin getting a bit irritated (bumpy) and oily if I overused this (around my nose and mouth, for the most part), so I recommend using it every other day at most. It can also be a bit drying if you don't continue with the rest of your skincare routine soon after you use it.<br /><br />Overall: Fantastic product, but use judgement and treat it as you would any other exfoliant.

Parabens is a type of preservative (which is found in many skin care products) try to avoid. And of course alcohol can severely dry out your skin causing more acne! ** The picture is of the Cure bottle and another one of my favorite products, Bior&eacute; UV protection $11. :)<br /><br />Anyways, I will repurchase!

  38. Oh wow. Where do I start about this product?? I wish I found it sooner. It's not Japan's best selling product for no reason! This is simply a gel that you rub into your skin to exfoliate it. Even after using makeup remover, cleanser, and my Mia clarisonic tool, this gel still removes a bunch of dead skin off my face that all the other stuff had failed to get rid of. It's been two weeks now since I got CURE and I am so addicted that I use it every other day to really deep clean my face. Not only has this product helped to even and lighten my skin tone (thus fading scars), it also PREVENTS breakouts. Why do we get acne? Because our skin has a tough time shedding the dead skin, so if you've got a layer of dead skin mixed in with oil and dirt, your pores will get clogged. Exfoliators help to remove this dead skin layer, but many are full of harsh ingreients or microbeads that can actually irritate your skin even more. I used to use ones like St Ives apricot scrub, but over time, I realized it was too rough on my skin. Then, I tried other exfoliating fgels and creams only to find that they were ineffective at removing dead skin, only to dry out my face without exfoliating. What makes CURE aqua gel a top product is that it is not only gentle, but it WORKS.<br /><br />You may be skeptical that the little white balls of stuff are from the gel clumping together. To test this out, I applied it to a plastic surface. A few little clumps formed, and I realized it was exfoliating the skin from my finger tip. Next I tried to put it on my face twice, and sure enough it did not clump up (because the first time all dead skin were already removed). I also applied it on my dad (who had just scrubed the heck out of his face with a loofah), and no dead skin balls formed. So the little balls are your dead skin cells, not the gel clumping by itself.<br /><br />Overall, I recommend this for people with dry skin, acne, and scars. Try it and you will love it.
  39. I've been using Cure for less than a week and I'm totally hooked. After switching from Proactiv face wash to bio sulfur soap, I needed something to slough away the dead skin cells. This stuff does it and SOOO gently, without the irritation (my skin is pale and sensitive and reacts negatively to scrubs, making my skin really red). On the bottle, it says to use it twice a week, but since it's so gentle, I'm able to use it almost everyday with wonderful results. My skin is smoother and I'm able to remove that gross dead layer of skin that builds up daily (especially when using acne products). It's definitely cool to see the little beads of dead skin form on your skin as you're rubbing it in. I don't believe Cure will clear up acne, but it works so very well following on a face wash made especially for acne prone skin. I've been using Bio Sulfur Soap by Grisi and it's great. Well, that's bull crap. I love this stuff, and I KNOW that it's working and sloughing off dead skin cells. How do I know? When I use it once per week, a lot of dead skin cells come off. I've tried using it two times in a row (back to back) and the second time, barely any beads form at all. Sometimes...nothing. It'll be just like rubbing water into your skin. This is because it's actually ridding your face of dead skin cells the first time. I recommend this exfoliation treatment for anyone. Like I've said before, I have sensitive skin and it works great. No redness. No irritation. Just smoother, exfoliated skin.

  83. So I was sold on all the positive reviews, before buying... and that's why I bought this. In the back of my mind, I didn't know what to expect. Some background: I'm a 37-year old fair-skinned Asian-American male. I have had a facial skincare routine every day of my life since I turned 30 years old. For 5 years, as far as cleansing goes, I was always using Stridex daily, and 2x a month using an acid exfoliator (the Olay serum/scrub kit). For the last couple years, I have switched to a basic water-based cleanser, and every 6-12 weeks I have applied either a 15% or 25% TCA chemical peel. In other words, I'm no stranger to what exfoliation feels like. As a kid, growing up, in the bath or shower, I would often scratch or rub my arms or legs to really give myself a deep clean. It would produce these \\"strands\\" of dead epidermis. But I would have to rub those areas really hard. Well, this \\"CURE\\" gel basically eliminates the need for all that rubbing/scratching. You rub gently over your face and within 15 seconds, sure enough, the epidermis starts to flake or \\"ball\\" off! Now, before I purchased, I read some people saying that if this was really your skin, that you'd be suffering from burns on your face. And I have two responses: (1) each time I apply this \\"CURE\\" gel, I squirt 4 pumps into my hands, and cover my face with it, and it appears to take off somewhere between 1/3 to 1/2 of (the dead stratum corneum layer of) my epidermis skin layer; and (2) a lot of the skin that is flaking or balling off is actually from your HANDS, not your face! Of course, you've read the reviews that claim that this product does nothing. Well, so I ran all the following tests: (a) First, when I wore a plastic glove and rubbed the gel between my fingers, there was absolutely ZERO balling, even after rubbing 3 minutes until it dried. So, that basically eliminated all these claims in these negative 1-star reviews that it was due to coagulation of the gel. (b) Then,I applied the lotion once, rinsed off, applied again, rinsed off, and applied again, rinsed off. Each of those 3 times I had the balling/flaking results. 3 times! Now, a note: by the time I rinsed off the third time, my skin was dry and stinging. It was the same kind of stinging I get from applying a 15% TCA peel! Maybe not as strong, so maybe it's similar to a 7% TCA peel, but the sensation is definitely the same. And that stinging sensation comes where the TCA peel most affects me--around my nostrils, and under my chin. (c) My third experiment was on a separate evening, where I applied the lotion with a plastic glove (you can also wear a plastic sandwich bag, like a glove, instead). This time, on the 3rd pass, I no longer got the balling/flaking results. Instead, when I used the leftover gel from this 3rd pass attempt on my forearm, well, the dead epidermis started to ball/flake. (d) My last experiment was to try applying this in the shower. And it didn't work! This gel doesn't work at all if you try to apply it to a wet face. It only works (and works REALLY well!) if you apply it to a clean dry face!!! The results are remarkable. My skin is glowing after using this product. So after reading all this, what am I trying to tell you?: #1: This stuff is for real, most definitely. The stuff balling up is most definitely your dead epidermis. #2: It's best to apply this with something, instead of direct contact with your hands. I will continue using a plastic glove or plastic bag to apply. #3. If you decide to apply this 2-3 times in a row, you may exfoliate all your epidermis, and you better cover up with an SPF lotion. #4. Only apply on a dry face! I hope this helps some of you in your usage or purchasing decisions. Cheers. 1-WEEK UPDATE: If you wear a plastic glove while applying, you may need to rub with significantly more pressure because the plastic is slick and there's no friction to rub the surface epidermis away.But more amazingly, after about a week of use, it has gently removed about 30% of a discoloration caused by a popped pimple. Usually I have to wait months for it to go away, or I use deep exfoliation on it and it gets irritated and sticks around longer. Finally, after a week of use, I've also discovered that my Ponds pore strips are much more effective now on my pores. Overall, I'm convinced that the balling of skin looks so strange because it is an agglomeration ('mixture') of both your dead skin and the product itself (which isn't so far-fetched given that the product isn't supposed to necessarily magically disappear!). I'm quite happy with the gentleness of this product.

I am sure about this bc I use spray tan and anytime I exfoliate it makes the tan come off my face but this does not effect my tan at all so I think it does nothing.

  153. THIS PRODUCT IS AMAZING.<br /> When I ordered this product, I had previously done a whole research on Asian skin care products and found out that most of them were really expensive and sometimes didn't even work. So when I came across Cure Natural Aqua Gel on a Youtuber's Channel and found it was really inexpensive, with positive reviews, I was really excited to try it out. It arrived really fast and with no problems. My product was easy to apply since it came with English instructions on the back. When I applied it on my face, slowly and gently massaging it, I felt a bunch of little balls coming off. I was surprised that such a soft and gentle exfoliator could have such an enormous effect, so I checked the product to see if it had any hidden balls within it but found none. So, as I like to think, I conducted a small experiment that goes as follows:<br /><br /> &#34;Since some parts of our bodies have higher or lower concentration of dead cells, if I use the same amount of product on these areas I should get a different amount of dead cells. And if I get the same amount of &#34;balls&#34; it means it is all within the product. (Making sense? It does in my head XD)<br />I decided to test two areas: 1) The elbows, 2) The face<br />Why? Well, if there is a part of the body people clean(or at least within my family) it's the face. I know I am too lazy to scrub my body every single day and thus my elbows don't get such a nice treatment. Besides, elbows are a joint where skin accumulates, thus more dead cells. ( I am not an expert)<br />Procedure:<br />So I pumped twice and applied it on my elbow which I know has a big concentration of dead cells. And as hypothesized( if you like to think of it that way ;D) a big amount of balls formed. Then, I applied the same amount of product to a part of my dad's face as equal in surface area as that of my elbows (I had already exfoliated mine so it doesn't count). My conclusion was that the product truly works, because the same amount of product generated different amounts of balls, meaning it must have reacted to the skin.<br /> It's a weird way of testing it out and I know many factors could have influenced the answers but all you really need as proof, is the feel of your skin.<br />Review:<br /> To really appreciate a product I write down my expectations VS. reality and with these, I draw my &#34;real expectations&#34; because having realistic expectations in mind really help to appreciate any product and understand it's value.<br /> For me these were my Expectations Vs Reality<br />Expectations<br />Yes, we all have wished our acne would simply disappear, together with the scars and all those skin problems after one application. &#34;My skin will turn to a beautiful and healthy glowing and perfect skin.&#34;<br />Reality<br />After years of doing nothing to my skin( I am guilty -.-), it won't go away magically, and if it does call me. Skin needs time to repair, so I have to be patient. There is no &#34;perfect&#34; skin so I should love my skin the way it is even though I look like a Mexican version of a vampire.<br /><br />Results<br /> The product is as gentle as you want it to be( if your not gentle with your skin you can scar it even more -.- like I did when I exfoliated with sugar and rubbed so hard on my skin). It has only being 2 weeks, and My acne is still there, but it has tremendously dwindled. I used to have acne all over my cheeks and now I only get one pimple every other day. My skin doesn't &#34;glow&#34; in the dark (LOL) but it does look a little more healthy and not so dull. The product has caused no &#34;after effects&#34;, it is pleasant to use and has done close to magic for my skin \(^_^)/<br /><br />OVER ALL<br /> I am so happy with this beautiful product sent from heaven. I have lived with acne my whole life like a lot of people, and I did my research, bought this product and now I am happy. It is worth every penny, and it does wonders(at least to my face), fast shipping, you name it.<br />I use this product with my skin care routine which is as follows:<br />1) A make up remover (if you wear make up, I don't so I can't recommend any but oils are good too if you want a more natural way)<br />2) A cleanser- use any of your preference, i haven't found a favorite yet.<br />3) An exfoliator- THIS ONE!<br />4) A toner- for this I use half Apple cider vinegar and half water because i don't like the idea of rubbing any alcohol product on my face.<br />5)A moisturizer- Even if I have oily skin, I moisturize my skin(I think is very important but can't tell if it will make it worst for others or not) I recommend Aveeno<br />6) Masks- sometimes I use honey for my red scars, or clay masks work too (Indian Clay)<br />7) A Spray - Avene Thermal Spring water spray is great to keep face moisturize if you don't want to apply face cream often, its a lighter feeling.<br /><br />Sorry for my bad English, Spanish is my first language. This is only my opinion and my craziness :D

  162. Pros:<br />- very gentle, doesn't feel like it is working if you don't look at it happening<br />- can be used practically anywhere on your body, if you so choose<br />- leaves skin feeling and smelling fresh (like rosemary)<br />- takes a decent amount of (only) dead skin off of any area applied<br />- very good for delicate or hard to scrub areas like the face or hand/feet cuticles<br />- doesn't aggravate areas with sores/scabs. On myself and on a friend, we had areas that could not be scrubbed or rubbed, but this product managed to painlessly remove dead skin from the area<br />- leaves skin very soft and clear afterwards<br /><br />Cons:<br />- only takes a certain amount of skin off with each application. If there is a LOT of dead skin, then expect to have to use it 2-3 times in that area (e.g. on my nose, cheeks, and feet, one application was not enough)<br />- clumps of dead skin are somewhat awkward to wash/rinse off, if you are not thorough it can be gross to find some on yourself later<br />- somewhat pricey, you might be able to make your own with some blended rosemary/ginkgo/aloe (but I have not tried)<br />- leaves non-oily areas dry, I recommend you moisturize accordingly<br />- some areas may feel sensitive after exfoliation (be mindful of your choices)<br /><br />Conclusions:<br />I believe that this product is totally amazing at what it does. My hands and face have never been softer; who knew there was so much dead skin on either? It's almost disgusting how much comes off, and painlessly too!<br /><br />Sidenote: This product definitely is not &#34;fake&#34; or a &#34;scam.&#34; I sincerely doubt the reviewers who say so.   207. I break out when I have had too much dairy, food high in sugar and stress. My breakouts are very deep under the skin, so waiting for it to finally surface or reduce can be a long process at times. I hardly get redness, but when the blemish begins to surface then it get slightly red. This past month consumed my time with back-to-back birthdays and BBQs (quite a good summer), but by early Aug. the effects were beginning to show on my skin.<br /><br />I got this mainly because I had a few breakouts which left scars on my face since early Aug and I have been aching for them to go away. I did have an exfoliant (St. Ives) but it wasn't doing the job. Another really annoying detail about these particular breakout were that although it was mainly scar tissue, I still felt the bump from the clogged pore underneath (SO ANNOYING).<br /><br />Long review short, I purchased this Aug. 26th. It was delivered Aug. 28th (Prime). I used it the same day. I washed my face and let it dry for 30 minutes and I use a small amount on my entire face (a dry face). One thing I noticed right away was that I really did feel and see skin debris on my face (gently rub) I was astonished BC I have never seen this with any other exfloliant I've use before. I only rubbed for a minute or 2 because I got nervous that even with gentle rubbing, I might loose my face. At this same time I remembered that I had not yet tried it on a small portion of my face to test it first. I rinse with warm water, then cool water and pat dried. I immediately noticed the scar tissue on my breakouts got smaller.<br /><br />Today, Aug. 30th I have not used the Cure exfoliator since. I have only cleansed and moisturized. I am not sure yetif it is wise to use this on a daily basis. Now, I have no visible scar tissue at all. There is a slight shade of the scar, but I have to get close to the mirror to see it. The bump under the scar tissue has significantly gotten smaller and I have smaller but fewer breakouts since. I am impressed and I will not use any other exfoliator unless this product becomes ineffective overtime.

  256. I've tried my share of exfoliators and while the pilling off of dead skin beads is a cool effect this doesn't leave the skin feeling as clean or as smooth as a normal BHA or AHA exfoliator. It's over priced for a mediocre job. I began using it as a full body exfoliator just to use it up and it was decent at that but again, nothing special, for an extraordinary price. After my disappointment I did some research about it online to figure out exactly HOW water was supposed to be used as an exfoliator. Apparently, as I suspected, it doesn't, the reason it pills up on skin like that is because something in the product clumps around oil, not skin. Which is why it will &#34;exfoliate&#34; less the second use on the same skin.<br /><br />What it IS good for is use as a makeup remover! The gel immediately clings to the makeup and pulls it off with the top layer of skin, easy to see when you've cleaned it all because the beads run white again. Also you still have to cleanse after use anyway.<br /><br />It’s neat gimmick but it's over priced and just isn't worth your time if you're just looking for an exfoliator. If you’re looking for a fun toy to play with your skin? Well then you decided if it's worth the price.
  257. Do not worry about the cost - this is the BEST. THING. EVER. I have uber sensitive skin and tried it on a patch of my hand first. My skin is so happy and yes - I do use it everywhere.   258. This product is the best exfoliator I've used so far. I have tried other beaded or brush exfoliators and don't find them as effective or gentle as this product. Other exfoliation products with beads does not do the job quite effectively and those that has the brush system is too harsh on the skin. The Cure Natural Aqua Gel is very gentle for even sensitive skin. It does not include perfumes or colors or most of any strong chemicals for my sensitive skin. You will have to get the instructions online through a search or read reviews of how reviewers have instructed on how to use this, because the instructions on the bottle is not in English. It is very simple to use. I prefer to wash my face and then apply one full pump of this product onto my clean, dried hands first, and then onto my dry face, in a quick circular motion (to prevent the product from drying too fast), then continue rubbing the facial skin back and forth or in circular motions until you sense that most of the &#34;dead&#34; or dry skin has flaked off of the face. You will literally feel and see the dead skin flakes on your face come off. I have tried also doing the top and bottom eyelid areas as well, with good results...keeping in mind to exfoliate less around the eye area than the rest of the face because it is more sensitive with thinner skin. You could literally exfoliate other parts of the body too if desired, but I have not tried that. I have not experienced any redness, itching, or discomfort post-use. It comes in a pump that is a good size for extensive use. I have only used it for a month now and use it on a weekly to bi-weekly basis. I think if I even use it more frequently, that I would not have any problems or be sensitive with it. Overall, it is an inexpensive purchase for the amount and its effectively. I love it!

  290. So, I was also a bit skeptical, as it seems many people on here were at first, but this stuff is serious business. I know that it actually is working because my skin can get very peely and flaky (I know - cute), but this stuff literally strips that flaky skin away. It's crazy and I have no idea how it works. I'm sure I can google it or something, but don't care enough to...just knowing it works is good enough for me.<br /><br />When I first tried it, my skin wasn't peeling, so I wasn't really that sure if it worked, but as I've been using it (for around 3 months now), I've tried it many times when my skin has been peeling so I've been able to witness the effects well. For instance, if my skin is peeling a bit on the side of my nose, I notice that more of that white stuff appears in that particular area when I use this stuff. I now know that this 'white stuff' is definitely my skin, since more comes off on the side of my nose than it does on the other parts of my face that aren't peeling.<br /><br />When I'm done using it, my skin feels so smooth, BUT it does get at least somewhat dryer. I just use some lotion and I'm A-OK, so not a problem.<br /><br />I use it probably on average every other day. It's not irritating for me, so sometimes I can use it more, but if I use it too often, I'll notice that none of the white forms, meaning no skin is coming off. If no skin is coming off, I don't see that there's a point. So, I would say there's no need to use it more than every other day and for some people, I'm sure even less than that. For me, I like to use it fairly often to manage the flaky skin.<br /><br />I will say that it is relatively expensive, but the bottle is a fair size and I've been using it a lot (as I said, probably every other day on avg.) and I still have about 1/4 of it left after 3 months. Also, I think I've been applying an excessive amount each time I use it. I tend to overindulge like that. But, I'm sure those who moderate how much they use could geteven more out of it.<br /><br />Lastly, I do get acne sometimes and I've noticed an improvement with the breakouts. I think it is partially this stuff, but it may also be that (pro-tip) I don't wash my face every morning with a cleanser anymore. This really worked for me with my acne. I think I was drying out my face too much, which was in turn also probably causing more of that flakiness, which I think would trap dirt and oil under my skin. This may not work for everyone, but I think more people should consider not washing their face every morning with anything other than water. At least it worked for me, so can't hurt to try for others I suppose...

When I've gotten peels in the past (after having skin cleaned of course) my dead skin would come off tinted. Do you mean to tell me that when I use this product, all of the sudden my dead skin turns white? C'mon. I've gotten better peels from Elmer's glue!

  368. I ordered this for my teenage nieces after I first discovered this in a store in Little Tokyo. My friends and I had seen this in a previous store and read how it was sold every 20 seconds in Japan. While that sounded impressive, I wasn't about to shell out $40 for it! Then we walked into the next store which had a tester! We proceeded to test it on our hands and were blown away when we saw what was coming off. I decided to splurge and don't regret my decision. I am a true believer in the benefits of exfoliation. While I'm a fan of Paula's Choice products and use her 2%BHA liquid as part of my daily routine I had been looking for an additional exfoliating product. I have somewhat sensitive skin and had stopped using my Clarisonic Mia because it was causing dry patches and I've tried Retin-A in the past, but always found it too harsh and drying. Now, I've found this amazing product and absolutely love it! I use it 2 times a week and I'm still amazed and excited to see the dead skin coming off my face! I'll admit at first I got a bit over-enthusiastic and used it every 2-3 days but found it was too drying so, for me, twice a week is perfect!<br /><br />Like others have noted, you must wait until your face is completely dry, after washing, before using Cure. Then I start applying it to my face, one pump at a time, using a total of 3-5 pumps. After I've covered my face and neck, I slowly start rubbing, then rinse. Your face will feel amazing and baby soft and perfect to absorb your skin care products.<br /><br />I do also agree with other reviewers that not all of the white gunk is actual dead skin, but is in fact a polymer. I took some in a small travel bottle for a trip because I could not imagine going a week without using this product. When I got back home, I used up the remaining product, then washed out the bottle only to find a whitish residue inside. That being said, I also believe that it IS exfoliating your skin which mixes with the polymer. It's harder to tell on your face, but if you try rubbing the inside of your wrist with some of the excess white fluid that ends up running down your hands, you'll see small grayish rolls of skin coming off. Anyone who has used an exfoliating glove or had a massage at a Korean Spa knows what rolls of dead skin look like. That's why I'm convinced Cure is actually exfoliating all that dead skin and it just makes my face feel wonderful and clean!<br /><br />BTW, The bottle I purchased in Little Tokyo had English instructions and list of ingredients and it recommended using the product within 6 months of opening.

That's because I didn't let it sit on my skin long enough for my skin type (and because I couldn't read the instructions). I soaked in the tub for about 3 min before rubbing my legs to see if The Cure would actually work this time. Well, it did. So much so, it scared me. The amount of brown skin -- not white pills - that rubbed and peeled off my arms and legs was disturbing. It didn't hurt or burn at all, but I still strongly considered consulting a doctor because of the amount of skin that came off. Actually, it was pretty disgusting. And I was too embarrassed to take pictures of the dead skin. I wanted to call my hubby in to show him, but didn't want him to have that visual in his memory bank. The product itself rolled slightly like glue, but was completely clear, very sticky, and overall looked nothing like the white stuff that forms when I rub it on my face.<br /><br />The first time I used it, I was getting 2-3 small breakouts.   571. I love this product! It truly works. I'm in my early 20s, asian/filipino, lighter-medium skin tone. Combination dry and oily skin. With occasional break outs, mostly on my cheeks or chin when they happen. And I know that it is skin coming off,not product flaking off. How? Because my skin was rough and dry with months of negligence. The first run through, I saw rolls of skin, which I knew were skin because it didn't look white. If you've ever scrubbed your skin to deeply exfoliate with a towel or with enough friction with your hands, or have ever rubbed your hands long enough as a child to see the tiny rolls of skin cells ball up... That's what it looks like--kinda gross to describe. But it confirms it is not fake. Of course after frequent use... For me every 2-3 days one application a day, and after 3-4 applications total (~1.5 weeks worth) I did notice the little skin balls lightening up and less in amount with each use, but at the same time... My face is much softer than its before exfoliation state, so perhaps I have already eliminated the couple months worth of dead skin accumulation, and revealed fresh skin with only couple days worth of dead, dry skin cells...so I'm sure there isn't much to exfoliate off once you've started to maintain your skin. After applying either my shiseido mattifying moisturizer, or any of my other moisturizers desired at the moment, my already smooth face felt and looked more smooth and soft than I could have ever imagined. In fact, I'm noticing less random breakouts despite sweating from the blazing Texas summer heat. Less dead skin cells means less stuff clogging pores.<br /><br />I feel comfortable walking out without foundation. On occasion, I might mix a couple drops of foundation into a pea-dime size amount of moisturizer to apply very sheer coverage. A bb cream would be well enough coverage, and full application of foundation is not necessary. Which I love because I hate wearing heavy face makeup in humid, steamy, Houston summerweather. I end up sweating it off or it feels like it's melting off and by a couple of hours in the sun, 1 hour of tedious blending and setting goes to waste. Now, I can feel comfortable in my own clear, radiant, soft skin! And feeling beautiful naturally is a feeling that is priceless for any woman.<br /><br />$30 is a bargain for the size of the bottle, and a little goes a long way to get desired results! And I received my product it perfect new condition in less than 1 week.<br /><br /> I highly recommend this to anyone to at least give it a try! Each person has different skin conditions. If it doesn't work with your skin, then maybe pass it on to a friend who might be able to benefit from its magic.
  572. I was in the market for a good exfoliation product that could remove flaky/dry facial skin (due to using the Obagi Nuderm system). For those unfamiliar with the Obagi Nuderm products; these are medical grade products that cause immense irration/dryness/flakiness etc for some weeks to eventually reveal &#34;new&#34; skin. Even though Obagi utilizes it's own exfoliation product (Obagi Exfoderm) to enhance the dead skin sloughing, I was getting tired of the long process of getting rid of the unsightliness and decided to hasten the sloughing by buying the Cure product.<br />I must say that despite it's obvious hype, the product does absolutely nothing when it comes to sloughing off dead skin. What it does do is it forms little balls of it's own product so it looks like skin sloughing off, gives you a smooth soft finish after the face wash (due to glycerin content) and does make your face feel quite clean. However, if you are truly looking to slough off dead skin, keep researching because this will not give you any type of removal other then a clean face wash! I was extremely disappointed since it did absolutely nothing for my flaky skin or it's sloughing and given it's price - I would have rather purchased a Glytone product.<br />I gave it three stars to indicate a good face wash but not as an effective exfoliating agent.

This made all the dry skin come right off, better than any scrubber ever did. And when I put lotion on after it worked way better than it ever had before. I know some people have doubts about what the stuff that comes off is, but I'm not a gullible person and I'm positive that this takes off at least a portion of a person's dead skin. It doesn't always take it all off, and it takes a few days to get rid of extra dry patches. But it does work!<br /><br />I'm not interested in skin care or beauty supplies. I can see why most people would think spending that much for some kind of magic water is ridiculous. But this made my skin feel less itchy and tight and much more comfortable. I don't get nearly as many zits or bumps. And when I do, they go away exponentially faster than they used to. And thankfully, it takes 2 drops of this big bottle to do your whole face. I know there's a best by date, but it's a joke. This still works just as well as the day I got it.<br /><br />Look up &#34;free cure samples&#34; on Google and you should be able to find some. I only had to pay a few dollars shipping. Try it if your skin is itchy, dry, or uncomfortable. And remember that it works best if you use some lotion after, just like you have to oil leather after you clean it.
  578. Read the reviews, decided to try it out. Holy cow! Thought the little balls might be the gel drying...kinda like glue balls, if you will. Did it a couple times and it didn't do it anymore. Did it on my neck and the skin balls were dirty colored (gross, I know). Worth the money. I was almost certain it was a scam and that I had wasted my money. As of this month, I was prescribed a topical acne cream solution (Tretinoin) by my doctor. One of the side effects of this ointment is that it makes my skin really dry/sensitive before I get acclimated to the treatment. This past week, my entire face has had a scaly texture that made it difficult to cover even with makeup. Regular face wash/exfoliator products and even some lotions make my skin sting really bad due to the tretinoin. I decided to give the Cure exfoliator another try out of desperation.   595. I have oily and acne prone skin. I had been using St. Ives Green Tea exfoliator prior to using this, and that has decreased the acnes already. Using Cure twice a week and St. Ives Green Tea exfoliator once a week, my skin has gotten softer and the amount of acnes I get has further decreased. The pores have gotten smaller too. I have not noticed any decrease in the appearance of scars though.<br />Because of the physical exfoliator I had been using, I did not get much white balls off my cheeks the first time, but I did get more on the chin and forehead. I have also tried this on my neck and back of my hands where I dont exfoliate regularly, and much more white balls formed, so I believe these white balls are actually dead skin cells. Cure does not make my skin feel tight or irritated.<br />One thing I dont like about Cure is that both face and hands must be completely dry for it to work, but it is so runny after applying that it makes a mess if not used in the shower, where it's hard to have completely dry face and hands...<br />The effect is not miraculous. The product is actually not that expensive as you get quite a bit of product. I'm not exactly sure, but I've heard this product expires six months after opening. If you're on a budget, buy one of the smaller, similar products with a nicer price tag and if you like that, buy this one for comparison.<br /><br />This product does work, and it actually does quite a good job at removing my dead skin cells, but about just as equal as my other products do. It also did make my face look cleaner and brighter looking, and yes, they are your dead skin cells coming off, not the actual product balling up. I actually think it could be a mixture of both. It's very watery and glides onto the face pretty nicely. I've used it on legs as my legs are quite dry, and I've noticed it doesn't provide as much moisture as my other products. but it gets the job done. I've bought and used this since about five months ago if that provides any other additional information.<br /><br />This gel would probably best fit sensitive or minimally dry skin. If your skin is extremely dry and flaky, this product is not going to get rid of your problem. It does moisturize as it contains a dose of glycerin and is good for sensitive skin mainly because it's mostly water and unscented, but it smells a bit like chlorine to me. Although it does actually do a pretty good job at taking away my dead skin cells, it's pretty equal in terms of other gel based exfoliators. A clean and dry face is recommended for best results before using. Dead skin and oil do not cause acne, bacteria that gets mixed in with it causes acne. Most exfoliators SHOULD fade scars because the point of it is to shed dead skin and reveal newer, fresher looking skin, however, lots of exfoliators don't dothis because of their harsh, grainy formula that can tear skin and cause more hyperpigmentation.<br /><br />What isn't overhyped is the seller, ppali beauty, very recommended! Package came in quick and neatly bubble wrapped which came with samples!

  628. No, that's not dead skin rolling up in all those little balls. Once the alcohol (yes, alcohol which dries skin) evaporates or dries, it forms the little globs that you think is dead skin being exfoliated. It's not dead skin. Don't be fooled.<br /><br />I have to admit, it makes a seriously great demo watching it happen, so compelling it makes it a best-selling product. If only it were true. But once you look into the science of it--all fake. Don't fall for it, save your money.<br /><br />Not worth the money, get something less expensive without the skin-drying alcohol.

I tried a lot of medication including antibiotics, various strengths of benzoyl peroxide, and birth control, but nothing made a major difference. Then everything changed! I've been using this every 2-3 days for the past month in conjunction with a daily moisturizer and BP acne wash and my skin has never been better. I leave Cure on until it's dry, then lightly wet my fingers and rub my skin. My dead skin starts rubbing off like dried glue, and it's wonderful. The first time brought off the most, by far, but this stuff still does its job even a month later. My skin is now softer, brighter, and clearer. I have the confidence to go makeup free any day now! I HIGHLY recommend.<br />****An important note**** I did experience more breakouts right after I started using this but continued anyway because my skin was getting softer. It turns out that I was just bring all the deep seated impurities to the surface, and now my skin is exponentially clearer, with breakouts MUCH rarer than ever before.

  669. This product is great to remove dead skin cells from your face! Unfortunately the bottle does not have instructions in English, just Japanese. I apply a thin layer of this gel on my face after cleansing and drying off. I wait for the product to dry some, and the dry skin cells start to become apparent on your face. Then I massage my face with my fingers (gently) which further loosens dead skin cells. Follow up with a good rinse off using a soft washcloth (if desired). I also use my cleanser to be sure I get the gel completely off, and follow up with toner and moisturizer. Works extremely well-does not seem to be harsh or chemically at all. I wouldn't recommend using this more than once or twice a week-you don't want to overdo it!

  713. As the gel dries it rolls up into little bits/balls which look like dead skin cells, making you THINK it's your skin being gently exfoliated. However the bits are NOT your dead skin cells, they are formed by the product. You can easily do a little experiment: Put on rubber or latex free gloves, place a small amount of product on one gloved hand and rub with the other glove hand, you'll see the same bits form, no skin involved.<br /><br />~*Ingredients*~<br />-Water<br />-Glycerin<br />-C10-30, alkyl acrylate crosspolymer: Thickeners that when rubbed form little bits/balls with this particular formula.<br />~*With Microscopic Amounts of the following*~<br />-Dicocodimonium: Emulsifier<br />-Chloride: Type of chloride is NOT revealed :-(<br />-Steartrimonium Bromide: Can't imagine why this would be in any product for face/skin. It's usually found in hair products. Considered a moderate hazard ingredient by the Cosmetics Database. The EWG lists warning regarding concentration limits, allergic reactions, and organ system toxicity due to animal studies that showed brain and nervous system effects and skin irritation at moderate doses and broad systematic effects at low doses. It is also considered a human toxicant by the CIR. Is 'considered' safe for use in hair rinse-off products and for use at concentrations of up to 0.25% in leave-on hair products. Dermal exposure is 'considered' safe up to 2%.<br />-Aloe: We all know this one :-)<br />-Gingko Biloba Extract: Antibacterial and Anti-fungal properties<br />-Rosmarinus officinalis/Rosemary leaf extract: Antimicrobial Agent; Antioxidant; Fragrance Ingredient; Skin-Conditioning Agent; Occlusive; perfuming<br />-Butylene Glycol: Chemical Preservative<br /><br />**TRUE EXFOLIATION can be achieved either mechanically by scrubbing/massaging the skin with a liquid containing small, hard particles (scrubs), also chemically by applying products containing active ingredients with a peeling effect (e.g. alpha-hydroxy acids, beta-hydroxy acids and others).<br /><br /> *** MAKE YOUR OWN EXFOLIANT: Mix a little olive oil and sugar and use to exfoliate face and body. Or mix a larger amount in a pretty container and leave on your counter for convenience. Sugar is a natural preservative.<br />The Costco where I live has Avocado Oil in stock, which is another oil that can be used and is quite nice for mature skin :-)<br /><br />[...]hydroxy acids and others).<br /><br /> *** MAKE YOUR OWN EXFOLIANT: Mix a little olive oil and sugar and use to exfoliate face and body. Or mix a larger amount in a pretty container and leave on your counter for convenience. Sugar is a natural preservative.<br />The Costco where I live has Avocado Oil in stock, which is another oil that can be used and is quite nice for mature skin :-)<br /><br />[...]

That said, perhaps my skin feels just a smidge softer after using it so I will finish it up, but I won't be reordering this product. In general, I have found the skin care products made in Korea to be superior to those made elsewhere. We have a Korean market with a skin care boutique where you can try things out and they will also give samples. This is where I first bought the Hankook product and then order more from Amazon.   826. Have you ever had a nightmare where you looked into a mirror and watched the skin melt off of your face? This is kind of like that.<br /><br />After trying several products in an attempt to even my complexion and perhaps help make my T-zone look less like a russet potato, I stumbled across this Japanese marvel. After reading several positive reviews across multiple websites, I threw thirty dollars into the internet and received the product less than two days later, presumably delivered via techno-wizardry. My curiosity (CURE-iosity? Get it?) reached a melting point; I had to use it instantly.<br /><br />The first thing you notice is the big blue ambiguous word on the bottle: Cure. If you saw this product on a shelf without researching it first, you would have no idea what it does. Is it hand-soap sponsored by Robert Smith? Is it sanitizer? Is it the cure for EVERYTHING? It also reads in small text 'natural aqua gel', which makes no sense. After using this product, I'm pretty sure that nothing about this product is natural. It's the stuff of witches. Let's squirt some into our hand, shall we?<br /><br />Cure 'Natural' Aqua Gel is a cloudy clear color, and the consistency is that of jello when you take it out of the fridge too early (Stop being so impatient). The product claims to be 90% water; if this is to be believed, I can only assume that the remaining 10% is voodoo magic.<br /><br />I pumped some into my hand and rubbed it on my face; it's unremarkable at first. There's no lather, no cooling or warming sensation, and no little gritty bits scratching your face, as there is in exfoliating scrubs. I'm standing there in the mirror, massaging this smooth, watery goop into my face for about fifteen seconds wondering: &#34;What did I just spend 30 dollars on?&#34;. Then it happens.<br /><br />As I massage the gel in circles on my face, suddenly that smooth feeling under my fingers starts to get a bit... gritty. I squeeze a bit more gel on my hands and continue, thinking maybe the gel is coagulating or something. The gritty feeling intensifies, and begins to feel more like i'm massaging rice into my face, and upon leaning closer into the mirror, I have to keep myself from screaming. It's skin. Oh god. THERE'S SKIN EVERYWHERE. I felt like a cicada shedding it's exoskeleton; there was balls of dead skin covering every inch of my face and hands. It's like when you were a kid and got craft glue on your hands, and got it off by rubbing them together. Except it's skin, and it's on your face.<br /><br />I spent the next two or three minutes shouting 'EW' and 'OH GOD IT'S SO GROSS' while continuing to rub my face; by this time it due to morbid fascination rather than desiring even coverage. I eventually couldn't stand the feeling of all the shedded skin on my face and hands anymore, so I leaned down to the sink and washed up. After drying my face, it looked like I just took off a mask; my face was clear, vibrant, soft, and squeaky clean. I put on some lotion and stared at the bottle of hoodoo magic for a bit before setting it on the counter. I've decided i'll always have a bottle of this.<br /><br />I have used it every two or three days for the past month; while I haven't had the same amount of dead skin sloughing off my face as the first time, there's always a good bit, and it's always slightly unnerving. Since then, my face has become soft and silky, free of blemishes entirely, and has started to clear up blackheads as well. It's as effective as it is disturbing, and I highly recommend it to anyone that wants to get real results with an exfoliating product. Just be ready to be grossed out.
  827. At first I thought it was just the gel sloughing off my face to give the appearing that my flaky, dried skin was coming off. I was mistaken. After years of dried skin issues I had to use this four times in a row before the dried skin stopped forming into clumps that could be brushed off. I also put some clumps under the microscope. Plenty of evidence of skin cells being lifted off. Plus, my skin looks and feels a hella lot better! Pretty happy that I have an in-home solution for a problem that has plagued me for a long time.
  828. Cheesus H Christ this stuff is amazing! I've never used something that worked so well!!

Here in the states we are used to our exfoliants having beads in them, thick,etc. I put it on in the shower anyway, rubbed it in circles as though it were a beaded wash and....felt the dry skin coming right off. I had so much dry skin come off, I had to do it twice!<br /><br />As soon as i got out, I looked in the mirror. This is the smallest Ive ever seen my pores, no lie. I don't think it really does &#34;exfoliate&#34;. In some way it does remove impurities off though. But don't expect to really exfoliate as how you would get from scrubs. But I personally don't believe the white stuff coming off are my dead skin. I believe it is part of the product to really get the dirt outta your face (or leftover makeup). Overall.   899. Originally found this at trade show. A must have. Try it you well be amazed.
  900. This was a pretty expensive purchase for me but I finally decided to get it. I had heard about Cure for a couple years but it was quite pricey so I decided to research other exfoliators that act like this one. If you don't know what this exfoliator is, it's a gel that you apply to your face and it loosens dead skin cells. Then when you rub your skin, the friction causes the skin cells to clump together and leaves your face with a newer layer of skin (it's basically a chemical peel, but much much gentler?). I wanted a gentle exfoliator since I have sensitive skin, and I felt like gritty exfoliators never did the trick or were too harsh. I got the Skin79 Crystal peeling Gel and it worked well! I had that one for over a year and I was running low so I decided to finally get Cure as the price per mL was cheaper than the Skin79 one. I'll sort of compare the two, so maybe that will help you decide on something.<br />The first thing I noticed about Cure was that the gel is quite watery. Use small pumps when applying it to your face so that it doesn't drip through your fingers. There is a very faint scent of alcohol but it isn't noticeable or irritating. Skin79's gel is more gel-like and thicker, which I think is easier in the application. There is, however, a very heavy scent, and although it is pleasant, I'd prefer no scent as fragrances can irritate the skin. When applying either, it's best to apply a good layer that covers your skin. If it's too thin, it will dry before you can really rub a lot of the skin off, and if it's too thick, it'll waste product and be quite messy. I find that applying a layer all over your face and waiting about 45 seconds before rubbing makes it easer than just rubbing the hell out of your skin. The product needs a bit of time to start working, and you can see parts of dead skin turning whitish when you let the product sit on it. If you start rubbing right after you apply it, you'll be rubbing for a while before you get any clumps. Both products make your skin clump similarly, but I think Cure dries a bit faster because it's more liquid-y, so it might be easier to work in sections (like do the bottom half of your face and then your forehead). Both leave great results; visibly smoother and softer skin. Exfoliating helps minimize acne, as there is less dead skin clogging up your pores. Use it weekly for the best results (don't use it every day as that might inflame your skin and waste product ). And for those that think it's fake or that it's the product and not your skin that is clumping up, it's not. I've tested both on my bathroom tiles and nothing ever clumps up. I've also tried exfoliating back to back and while the first time there was a lot of dead skin, the second time there was barely any (because you exfoliated most of the dead skin off). I definitely recommend this to people with sensitive and acne-prone skin! You might want to try the Skin79 one before shelling out the money for this, but this big bottle of Cure will last quite a while!
  901. I cannot express how impressed I am by this product! Forever customer right here! I have combination (oily+normal) skin and I've had a hard time finding something that doesn't over-dry me or make me feel greasy in the long run. This Cure gel exfoliator is incredible! Works just as most of these reviews say, and I can tell a difference in the texture of my skin immediately after cleansing. My wife has a combination of dry but acne prone skin, and since using this product, she's seen a massive improvement in her skin. She suffers from rosacea, but this product doesn't irritate her or cause her to break out. In fact, it seems to clear up some of her existing scars and definitely removes any dry, flaking skin. I recommend this to anyone and everyone to at least try!

I checked the reviews and figured I'd give it a shot. I took the reviews with a grain of salt and I was hesitant and skeptical when I first tried it because if you have experience with exfoliators you know that sometimes its just the product building up on your skin and it ends up not really doing anything. This is definitely not that! I did it back to back a couple of times to make sure it wasn't just product buildup and after about 3 times I didn't get any more of the white beads on my face. My skin feels lovely and soft. I had bumps along my jawline that I thought were hormonal from monthly lady time but when I was done they were completely gone. I'm guessing I was just in serious need of exfoliation but overall I really was blown away. I've noticed that some reviews have said it lightens red spots left from blemishes but I haven't had it long enough to determine that, however, I'm looking forward to it! Also, it might be pretty expensive but it's a very large bottle and after the first couple of times you'll only need 1 or 2 pumps to cover your whole face and probably won't have to use it but once or twice a week so it will last you months. I'm not sure how they do it but the Asians have completely nailed the beauty market. I have a South Korean BB cream that I adore as well. I can't stop raving about their products. Thank god for Amazon or it'd be impossible to get such high quality beauty items here. I will definitely buy this again when I run out!

Dry face completely.<br />3. Apply a fair amount of Cure to your face. Too little product does not work well, so don't be stingy!<br />4. Don't believe me? Try using the product several times in a row - alleged &#34;skin cells&#34; form every time, meaning the eventually you should be rubbing raw skin...but you won't because it's not your skin peeling off.

  995. Cure Natural –. Exfoliators, as you probably know, work typically work in one of two ways: by chemically loosening dead skin cells with an alpha hydroxy acid or similar chemical. Or by mechanically removing dead skin cells with an abrasive particle like a walnut shell or a polyethylene bead. This product contains neither type of ingredient. It does, however, contain “Activated Hydrogen Water? The balls are formed as the water evaporates and the acrylates polymer comes out of solution. (Some products like this claim that the “balls” are actually the dead skin cells but that’s not true.) I suppose the balls could give some degree of exfoliation but I wonder if they’d work as well as particles specifically sized for that task. the plastic micro-bead issue plays out. They gained popularity because they are less abrasive than walnut shells and other similar exfoliators. Now they’re losing popularity become of their environmental impact. thebeautybrains.com

I really enjoyed the feeling of rubbing it on my face and seeing the &#34;dead skin&#34; come off. I did some research when it was time to get more and this seemed like a comparable option that cost a tiny bit less. This formula is a bit more watery than you would expect a gel to be. You should also leave it on about 20 seconds before you start rubbing it, any longer and it completely dries and you cannot rub it off you have to wash it off which makes the product then useless. I know there is definitely doubts about it working and whether it's the product that balls up as oppose to the dead skin it promises. I put this to the test and the dry skin came completely off it and I covered it with makeup seamlessly. I use it ever other day now after I shower. I am such a believer I this, if I forget to use this a couple of days my skin gets both flaky dry and greasy ew. However, I use an anti-aging retinol cream twice a week and two days after I use it I always have dry, flaky skin that my normal exfoliation doesn't take care of. That's when I use this gel, and it works spectacularly. It gets all the flaky skin off without irritation. And I mean without irritation. Before I started using this, I tried many grainy scrub exfoliators and even the least harsh one would make my skin red, and it hurt! But, heed this warning: if you use it and don't think it has exfoliated enough, DO NOT use it again right away! I was one of those people that was skeptical this was actually removing dead skin from my face, so I figured it wouldn't hurt to do it twice. I was wrong. I'd already exfoliated all the dead skin off. Using it again right away exfoliated away my new, happy skin and it hurt. A lot. Any moisturizer I put on after that made it hurt even more. Also, my boyfriend (who used to never do much to take care of his skin because skin care products &#34;don't do anything&#34;), uses this more than I do. He likes it so much because he can SEE it's working when the little clumps form. He even uses moisturizer now, because he wants to keep his skin as smooth as it is after he uses this gel.

I know so many things are much much smaller and more expensive in Japan. But this one was good size for this price.<br /><br />I jumped into the shower with my daughter and tried this product.   1110. This exfoliator is an absolute must-have in every skincare routine. Cure doesn't break me out and is great at removing dull, dead skin. It's essentially a \\"peeling gel\\", but don't let that deter you from buying the product because that label sounds harsh on the skin. Cure is actually super gentle and claims to made up of over 90% water! The exfoliation process is super easy and pretty clean: After washing your hands, pump the bottle 2 times into your hands and apply this allover a DRY face. Wait about 5-10 seconds and GENTLY massage the product into your skin (while avoiding the delicate eye area). You'll see these tiny white or fleshtone balls appear, which is supposed to be a combination of your dead skin and the product itself that have been removed from your face. Afterwards just wash off the balls from your face with cool water and enjoy your super smooth and radiant skin! Continue with the rest of your skincare routine (cleanser, toner, repairing lotion, treatment, moisturizer, etc.)and keep in mind that if you use a micro-exfoliating cleanser like Proactiv, that you should use is as a more of a 1 minute wash off mask (do not rub it in like you usually would, but let it \\"rest on the skin\\" so that you still get the acne fighting goodness). It's best to use this MAXIMUM once a week, or once every other week if you use a micro-exfoliating cleanser like Proactiv. Bottom line: I recommend this to everyone regardless of skin type as exfoliating is an important part of proper skincare and Cure is much more gentle in comparison to \\"physical\\" exfoliating products like St. Ives that rely on gritty bits which can be off-putting to those with sensitive skin.

But if you just use it for your face and neck a few times a week, a bottle should last over 3 months or more.<br /><br />Don't be put off by the lack of English directions. There are so many great videos on YouTube showing how to use it, but you really don't even need to watch one. Just apply a couple of pumps of gel to the face or wherever you want to slough off the dead skin,....wait about a minute and rub in a circular motion with two or three fingers. You will feel and see little white balls, which is the dead skin dulling the complexion. Rinse off and apply your moisturizer. It is aquick process that couldn't be easier, and best of all,...it works!
